result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly R. Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Pre Sentence Report (sealed)

Case Called: 9:05 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jack Bliss. 
Parties have received the PSI's. Parties state corrections that are to be made.
State makes sentencing argument. Defense makes sentencing argument.
OTR: 9:39 am
BOTR: 9:44 am
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Repeater-Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substances On or Near a School)>> 5 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 3 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Submit to an alcohol and drug abuse assessment and follow through with any AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances and Alcohol,  You shall not enter into an establishment where the primary function is the sale or consumption of alcohol, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and $500 of Buy Money to be paid to Wausau PD, DNA sample. Eligible for SAP, NOT CIP. Defendant has 80 days credit.

Ct. 4 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place-Repeater)>>  2 Years WSPS, 1 Years IC and 1 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances and Alcohol, You shall not enter into an establishment where the primary function is the sale or consumption of alcohol, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and $500 of Buy Money to be paid to Wausau PD, DNA sample. Eligible for SAP, NOT CIP. Defendant has 80 days credit.

PSI TO BE SEALED.

DEFENDANT REMANDED TO WSPS.

Adjourned: 10:16 am
PSI sent to ADA Kyle Mayo and Attorney John Bliss via interoffice mail
Sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
